Description: Rim sherd of possibly Aeolian pottery dinos; white slip; interior: glaze line at top of rim, reserved below; on top of rim, part of double guilloche pattern, worn; glazed streaky brown on underside of rim.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Antikenmuseum, Heidelberg. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For parallels, see British Museum 1924,1201.2, 1924,1201.3, and 1888,0601.499.d. Lemos identifies the sherd as Chian but the interior slip is not consistent with Chian dinoi.
Bibliographic references: CVA Heidelberg III / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Deutschland Heidelberg, Universität Band 3 (p. 109, no. 8, pl. 137, no. 6)
Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 247, no. 299)
Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 75 no. Nau 3, pl. 1, fig. c)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GK.35)
